page.title: 02Population, Eaton B & Edlesb
page.content: Up to fairly recent times, everyone knew everybody else in their village. Most had been born there, worked locally and many could trace their roots in the locality back for several generations. A major concern among the villagers is that this is all changing. In the 10 years from 1971 to 1981 the number of houses increased by nearly 25% and a further 200 houses are to be built in Eaton Bray alone - mainly on the site of the old Wallace Nurseries that used to provide local employment. Population growth has been well over 30% since 1961 with Edlesborough more than doubling from 547 to over 1100 and Eaton Bray up over 50% from 1509 to around 2300. Most of the recent new houses have been relatively expensive, 4-bedroom, detached,'executive-style' homes.
